sait.mls.persistence

Interface Broker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientBroker, CommercialPropertyBroker, ResidentialPropertyBroker

    public interface Broker
    An interface that defines how a database back end of some type can be accessed by a Graphical User Interface defined as the front end.
    Version:
    February 4, 2019
    Author:
    Dave Watson, Nick Hamnett

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeBroker()
      Method to release resources allocated to the broker and save all modified data.
      boolean persist(java.lang.Object o)
      Abstract generic method to call a data persist method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the back end so the information can be permanently written to the database.
      boolean remove(java.lang.Object o)
      Abstract generic method to call data removal method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the back end so the information can be deleted from the database.
      java.util.List search(java.lang.Object o)
      Abstract generic method to call search method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the Graphical User Interface defined as the front end.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        java.util.List search(java.lang.Object o)
        Abstract generic method to call search method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the Graphical User Interface defined as the front end.
        Parameters:
        o - a Object containing the value of the item being searched for.
        Returns:
        a List of objects matching the search criteria.

      • persist

        boolean persist(java.lang.Object o)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Abstract generic method to call a data persist method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the back end so the information can be permanently written to the database. The Graphical User Interface defined as the front end confirms that the information has been added correctly.
        Parameters:
        o - an Object containing the object information to be added the database.
        Returns:
        a boolean confirming to the GUI that the data has been added correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - of any type can be thrown up to the calling method during a persist of data in case a validation is require at the data file level.

      • remove

        boolean remove(java.lang.Object o)
        Abstract generic method to call data removal method from a back end database structure of some type and brokers the information on to the back end so the information can be deleted from the database. The Graphical User Interface defined as the front end confirms that the information has been logically deleted.
        Parameters:
        o - an Object containing the object information to be deleted from the database.
        Returns:
        a boolean confirming to the GUI that the data has been deleted.

      • closeBroker

        void closeBroker()
        Method to release resources allocated to the broker and save all modified data. NOTE if this method is not called data may be lost.
